body_html: @smessmer Yes, I agree that it is a bit too magical. The reason I did the SFINAE part is not for tensor.to but to support existing usage of constructing TensorOptions via TensorOptions({kCUDA, -1}). Maybe we don't necessarily need to support that, but the error message will be weird.. cc @goldsborough
body_text: @smessmer Yes, I agree that it is a bit too magical. The reason I did the SFINAE part is not for tensor.to but to support existing usage of constructing TensorOptions via TensorOptions({kCUDA, -1}). body: @smessmer Yes, I agree that it is a bit too magical. The reason I did the SFINAE part is not for `tensor.to` but to support existing usage of constructing TensorOptions via `TensorOptions({kCUDA, -1})`. Maybe we don't necessarily need to support that, but the error message will be weird.. cc @goldsborough
